page.title: 11Farming in Pimperne.
page.content: Mr Boyt,who farms Manor Farm,has been farming all his life and has lived in Pimperne for 14 years.His farm has grown in size but he has the same number of men working for him.He has more and bigger machinery and has doubled the yield of corn he can get from one acre.He has 130 friesian dairy cows,30 sheep,called mules,and a cross between Swaledale and Border Leicester,and 40 calves.He grows winter wheat and barley and rotates crops every 2 years.Mr Boyt is keen on conservation.He believes hedges may be removed for the sake of efficiency but what is removed must be replaced. He cannot say what changes may come in the future.The European Economic Community fixes prices and there is a surplus of farm products.The future depends on the decisions of politicians.
